children.name: friendly
children.definition: a friendly game is played for pleasure or practice, and not because it is important to win: giao hữu
examples: The teams are playing a friendly match on Sunday.

children.name: a friendly match against AC Milan
parts of a series of games
decider
children.definition: informal the last part of a game or competition, which will show who the winner is : trận quyết định
examples: They lost what was regarded as the championship decider at Leeds.
Jones scored the decider in the final minute.

children.name: final
children.definition: the last and most important game, race, or set of games in a competition : chung kết
examples: be through to/reach the final
He’s through to the men’s tennis final for the first time.
Last year we gotthrough tothe final.
The men's basketball final will be on Sunday.
the finals(= the last few games or races in a competition)
the NBA finals
cup final[the last and most important game in a competition for a cup, especially a football competition] chung kết tranh cúp
Manchester United has won the FA (= Football Association) Cup Final for the last two years in a row.

children.name: semi-final
children.definition: UK/semifinalUS (semiinformal) one of the two games that are played to decide who will take part in the final game of a competition : trận bán kết
examples: Who's in the semi-finals?
She's the youngest player ever toget through to/advance toa semi-final.

children.name: quarter-final
children.definition: UKquarterfinalUS one of the four games near the end of a competition, whose winners play in the two semi-finals : trận tứ kết

children.name: an event between two teams or people
qualifier
children.definition: a game from which the winner will go on to compete in the next part of a competition : trận đấu loại
examples: Belgium and Italy are playing in tonight's qualifier.

children.name: the World Cup qualifier against the Netherlands
game
children.definition: an occasion when two people or two teams compete against each other in a game or sport :
examples: Did you see the game on TV last night?
a game of tennis/football etc
Would you like to have a game of tennis?
game against/with
England’s World Cup game against Holland

children.name: play a game
examples: They explained how to play the game.

children.name: see/watch a game
examples: Did you see the game last night?

children.name: have a game
examples: British English They were having a game of pool.

children.name: win/lose a game
examples: A.C. Milan won the game with a last-minute goal.|Arsenal lost the game because of a mistake by their goalkeeper.

children.name: the game is tied
children.definition: both teams or players had the same score
examples: The game was tied 10-10 at halftime.

children.name: draw a gameBritish English
children.definition: end the game with the same score as the opposing team or player
examples: We played badly and were lucky to draw the game.

children.name: a basketball/baseball etc game
examples: He was watching a baseball game on TV.

children.name: a home game
children.definition: played at a team's own sports field
examples: Next Saturday Liverpool have a home game against Manchester United.

children.name: an away game
children.definition: played at an opposing team's sports field
examples: We didn't win any away games last season.

children.name: a league game
children.definition: played as part of a league competition
examples: There's a big league game against Chelsea on Saturday.

children.name: a cup game
children.definition: played as part of a cup competition
examples: He hopes to play in the cup game on Wednesday.

children.name: a playoff gameAmerican English
children.definition: one of a series of games played by the best teams in a competition to decide the final winner
examples: This is the first of their five playoff games.

children.name: a play-off gameBritish English
children.definition: played to decide the winner after a previous game ended with both teams having equal points

children.name: match
children.definition: especially UKan organized sports event between two teams or people - used especially about soccer, rugby, cricket, tennis, or chess:trận đấu
examples: It’s our last match of the season.
match against/between/with
the match between Nigeria and Ireland
Good teams win their home matches.
Fitness is still important in friendly matches.
The rugby club has a friendly next week against the Giants.
return matchanother game between the same teams or players trận lượt về
We enjoyed the game so much that we arranged a return match for the next week.
exhibition matcha single sports game that is not part of a larger competition, in which the players show their skills
testimonial matcha match played to honour and make money for a famous player
test matcha game of cricket or rugby played by the national teams of two countries

children.name: go to a match
examples: I love going to football matches.

children.name: watch a match
examples: I watched the match on TV.

children.name: play a match
examples: We played the match in heavy rain.

children.name: lose a match
examples: They lost the match, despite playing very well.

children.name: win a match
examples: Do you think we'll win our next match?

children.name: draw a match
children.definition: finish with the score even
examples: United have drawn their last two matches.

children.name: have a match
children.definition: be scheduled to play a match
examples: Do we have a match on Sunday?

children.name: postpone a match
children.definition: arrange for it to happen at a later time
examples: Our first match was postponed because of bad weather.

children.name: miss a match
children.definition: not play in a match
examples: He missed two matches because of an ankle injury.

children.name: level the match
children.definition: make the score level
examples: Woods won the last two holes to level the match.

children.name: clinch the match
children.definition: to win a match by scoring a goal, hitting a winning ball etc
examples: Ronaldo clinched the match with a brilliant goal.

children.name: referee a match
children.definition: be the person on the field who makes sure players follow the rules
examples: The matches are refereed by the children's parents.

children.name: a match kicks off
children.definition: it starts
examples: The match kicks off at 3.30 pm.

children.name: great/brilliant
children.definition: very good to watch
examples: We're sure it's going to be another great match.

children.name: exciting
examples: The match could not have been more exciting.

children.name: thrilling
children.definition: very exciting
examples: There were some thrilling matches at Wimbledon this year.

children.name: tough
children.definition: difficult
examples: At this stage of the competition, every match is tough.

children.name: close
children.definition: with each team playing equally well
examples: Germany won the match, although it was close.

children.name: an important/crucial match
examples: Luckily, all their players are fit for such an important match.

children.name: a big match
children.definition: an important match
examples: Are you going to watch the big match on TV?

children.name: a football/rugby/tennis etc match
examples: There was a rugby match going on on the school field.

children.name: a home match
children.definition: played at the place where a team usually practises
examples: They have won their last five home matches.

children.name: an away match
children.definition: played at the place where the opponent usually practises
examples: This is their last away match of the season.

children.name: a live match
children.definition: shown on TV as it happens
examples: There is a live match on TV every Wednesday evening.

children.name: a friendly match/ friendly
children.definition: not part of a competition

children.name: a qualifying match
children.definition: to decide who plays in a competition
examples: They won all their qualifying matches.

children.name: a semi-final match
children.definition: between two of the last four teams left in a competition
examples: Spain beat Russia in their semi-final match last night.

children.name: man of the match
children.definition: the best player in a match
examples: Henri was named man of the match.

children.name: encounter
children.definition: an occasion when two teams play against each other : cuộc chạm trán

children.name: encounter with
examples: In their last encounterwithItaly, England won 3-2.

children.name: derby
children.definition: UKa sports match between two teams from the same area or city : trận giao tranh
examples: a local derby
alocalderby between Manchester United and ManchesterCity

children.name: run-off
children.definition: an extra competition to decide the winner, because the leading competitors have finished equal
examples: a run-off race

children.name: play-off
children.definition: 1UKa game played to decide who will win after a previous game has ended with two teams or players having equal points

children.name: event
children.definition: one of a set of races or competitions: lượt thi đấu
examples: The next event will be the 100 metres.
The 800 metres is not his best event.
The women's 200 metre event will be followed by the men's 100 metres.

children.name: heat
children.definition: one of several races or competitions whose winners then compete against each other :
examples: She came second in her heat, with a time of 23.2 seconds.
Bill finished second in his heat.

children.name: round
children.definition: a part of a competition that you have to finish or win before you can go on to the next part : hiệp, lượt đấu, vòng đấu
examples: the first/final/next/qualifying etc round
I got beaten in the first round.
Two of their candidates made it through to the next round.
She was knocked out of the championship in the third round.
round of
the final round of the championship

children.name: interval
children.definition: UKintermissionUS  a short period between the parts of a sports event: giữa hiệp
examples: He scored his first goal of the match three minutes after the interval.

children.name: half time
children.definition: half-time/  a short period of rest between two parts of a game, such as football or basketball : giữa hiệp

children.name: a half-time lead
examples: Italy had a comfortable three-goal lead over France by half-time.
What was the half-time score?

children.name: at half-time
examples: The score at half-time was 34–7.

children.name: half
children.definition: one of the two parts into which a sports event is divided

children.name: first/second half
examples: France played very well in the first half.

children.name: injury time
children.definition: / stoppage timeUKplaying time added on to a game such as football because of time lost when players are injured : bù giờ
examples: not yet : additional time

children.name: full time
children.definition: UKthe end of the normal period of playing time in a sports game: hết trận
examples: As the ball went in, the referee blew his whistle for full time.

children.name: at full time
examples: The score was 2-2 at full time.

children.name: time-out
children.definition: time out a short break during a sports match when the teams can rest, get instructions from their manager etc : thời gian không tính

children.name: call time out/ call a time out
examples: With 15.7 seconds left, Washington Statecalled time out.
The coachcalleda time out to discuss strategy.
